description: Adds an integration between the service and a third-party service, which includes Amazon AppFlow and Amazon Connect. An integration can belong to only one domain. To add or remove tags on an existing Integration, see TagResource/ UntagResource.

parameters.name: DomainName
parameters.description: The unique name of the domain.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: FlowDefinition
parameters.description: The configuration that controls how Customer Profiles retrieves data from the source. Description (string) --- A description of the flow you want to create. The specified name of the flow. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only. Spaces are not allowed. The Amazon Resource Name of the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key you provide for encryption. ConnectorProfileName (string) --- The name of the AppFlow connector profile. This name must be unique for each connector profile in the AWS account. The type of connector, such as Salesforce, Marketo, and so on. IncrementalPullConfig (dict) --- Defines the configuration for a scheduled incremental data pull. If a valid configuration is provided, the fields specified in the configuration are used when querying for the incremental data pull. DatetimeTypeFieldName (string) --- A field that specifies the date time or timestamp field as the criteria to use when importing incremental records from the source. Specifies the information that is required to query a particular source connector. Marketo (dict) --- The properties that are applied when Marketo is being used as a source. The object specified in the Marketo flow source. S3 (dict) --- The properties that are applied when Amazon S3 is being used as the flow source. The Amazon S3 bucket name where the source files are stored. BucketPrefix (string) --- The object key for the Amazon S3 bucket in which the source files are stored. Salesforce (dict) --- The properties that are applied when Salesforce is being used as a source. The object specified in the Salesforce flow source. EnableDynamicFieldUpdate (boolean) --- The flag that enables dynamic fetching of new (recently added) fields in the Salesforce objects while running a flow. IncludeDeletedRecords (boolean) --- Indicates whether Amazon AppFlow includes deleted files in the flow run. ServiceNow (dict) --- The properties that are applied when ServiceNow is being used as a source. The object specified in the ServiceNow flow source. Zendesk (dict) --- The properties that are applied when using Zendesk as a flow source. The object specified in the Zendesk flow source. A list of tasks that Customer Profiles performs while transferring the data in the flow run. (dict) --- A class for modeling different type of tasks. Task implementation varies based on the TaskType. ConnectorOperator (dict) --- The operation to be performed on the provided source fields. Marketo (string) --- The operation to be performed on the provided Marketo source fields. S3 (string) --- The operation to be performed on the provided Amazon S3 source fields. Salesforce (string) --- The operation to be performed on the provided Salesforce source fields. ServiceNow (string) --- The operation to be performed on the provided ServiceNow source fields. Zendesk (string) --- The operation to be performed on the provided Zendesk source fields. DestinationField (string) --- A field in a destination connector, or a field value against which Amazon AppFlow validates a source field. The source fields to which a particular task is applied. (string) --- TaskProperties (dict) --- A map used to store task-related information. The service looks for particular information based on the TaskType. (string) --- (string) --- Specifies the particular task implementation that Amazon AppFlow performs. The trigger settings that determine how and when the flow runs. Specifies the type of flow trigger. It can be OnDemand, Scheduled, or Event. TriggerProperties (dict) --- Specifies the configuration details of a schedule-triggered flow that you define. Currently, these settings only apply to the Scheduled trigger type. Scheduled (dict) --- Specifies the configuration details of a schedule-triggered flow that you define. The scheduling expression that determines the rate at which the schedule will run, for example rate (5 minutes). DataPullMode (string) --- Specifies whether a scheduled flow has an incremental data transfer or a complete data transfer for each flow run. ScheduleStartTime (datetime) --- Specifies the scheduled start time for a scheduled-trigger flow. ScheduleEndTime (datetime) --- Specifies the scheduled end time for a scheduled-trigger flow. Timezone (string) --- Specifies the time zone used when referring to the date and time of a scheduled-triggered flow, such as America/New_York. ScheduleOffset (integer) --- Specifies the optional offset that is added to the time interval for a schedule-triggered flow. FirstExecutionFrom (datetime) --- Specifies the date range for the records to import from the connector in the first flow run.

nested_params.name: Description
nested_params.description: A description of the flow you want to create.

nested_params.name: FlowName
nested_params.description: The specified name of the flow. Use underscores (_) or hyphens (-) only. Spaces are not allowed.

nested_params.name: KmsArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name of the AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key you provide for encryption.

nested_params.name: SourceFlowConfig
nested_params.description: The configuration that controls how Customer Profiles retrieves data from the source.

nested_params.name: ConnectorProfileName
nested_params.description: The name of the AppFlow connector profile. This name must be unique for each connector profile in the AWS account.

nested_params.name: ConnectorType
nested_params.description: The type of connector, such as Salesforce, Marketo, and so on.

nested_params.name: IncrementalPullConfig
nested_params.description: Defines the configuration for a scheduled incremental data pull. If a valid configuration is provided, the fields specified in the configuration are used when querying for the incremental data pull.

nested_params.name: DatetimeTypeFieldName
nested_params.description: A field that specifies the date time or timestamp field as the criteria to use when importing incremental records from the source.

nested_params.name: SourceConnectorProperties
nested_params.description: Specifies the information that is required to query a particular source connector.

nested_params.name: Marketo
nested_params.description: The properties that are applied when Marketo is being used as a source.

nested_params.name: Object
nested_params.description: The object specified in the Marketo flow source.

nested_params.name: S3
nested_params.description: The properties that are applied when Amazon S3 is being used as the flow source.

nested_params.name: BucketName
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 bucket name where the source files are stored.

nested_params.name: BucketPrefix
nested_params.description: The object key for the Amazon S3 bucket in which the source files are stored.

nested_params.name: Salesforce
nested_params.description: The properties that are applied when Salesforce is being used as a source.

nested_params.name: Object
nested_params.description: The object specified in the Salesforce flow source.

nested_params.name: EnableDynamicFieldUpdate
nested_params.description: The flag that enables dynamic fetching of new (recently added) fields in the Salesforce objects while running a flow.

nested_params.name: IncludeDeletedRecords
nested_params.description: Indicates whether Amazon AppFlow includes deleted files in the flow run.

nested_params.name: ServiceNow
nested_params.description: The properties that are applied when ServiceNow is being used as a source.

nested_params.name: Object
nested_params.description: The object specified in the ServiceNow flow source.

nested_params.name: Zendesk
nested_params.description: The properties that are applied when using Zendesk as a flow source.

nested_params.name: Object
nested_params.description: The object specified in the Zendesk flow source.

nested_params.name: Tasks
nested_params.description: A list of tasks that Customer Profiles performs while transferring the data in the flow run.

nested_params.name: ConnectorOperator
nested_params.description: The operation to be performed on the provided source fields.

nested_params.name: Marketo
nested_params.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Marketo source fields.

nested_params.name: S3
nested_params.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Amazon S3 source fields.

nested_params.name: Salesforce
nested_params.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Salesforce source fields.

nested_params.name: ServiceNow
nested_params.description: The operation to be performed on the provided ServiceNow source fields.

nested_params.name: Zendesk
nested_params.description: The operation to be performed on the provided Zendesk source fields.

nested_params.name: DestinationField
nested_params.description: A field in a destination connector, or a field value against which Amazon AppFlow validates a source field.

nested_params.name: SourceFields
nested_params.description: The source fields to which a particular task is applied.

nested_params.name: TaskProperties
nested_params.description: A map used to store task-related information. The service looks for particular information based on the TaskType.

nested_params.name: TaskType
nested_params.description: Specifies the particular task implementation that Amazon AppFlow performs.

nested_params.name: TriggerConfig
nested_params.description: The trigger settings that determine how and when the flow runs.

nested_params.name: TriggerType
nested_params.description: Specifies the type of flow trigger. It can be OnDemand, Scheduled, or Event.

nested_params.name: TriggerProperties
nested_params.description: Specifies the configuration details of a schedule-triggered flow that you define. Currently, these settings only apply to the Scheduled trigger type.

nested_params.name: Scheduled
nested_params.description: Specifies the configuration details of a schedule-triggered flow that you define.

nested_params.name: ScheduleExpression
nested_params.description: The scheduling expression that determines the rate at which the schedule will run, for example rate (5 minutes).

nested_params.name: DataPullMode
nested_params.description: Specifies whether a scheduled flow has an incremental data transfer or a complete data transfer for each flow run.

nested_params.name: ScheduleStartTime
nested_params.description: Specifies the scheduled start time for a scheduled-trigger flow.

nested_params.name: ScheduleEndTime
nested_params.description: Specifies the scheduled end time for a scheduled-trigger flow.

nested_params.name: Timezone
nested_params.description: Specifies the time zone used when referring to the date and time of a scheduled-triggered flow, such as America/New_York.

nested_params.name: ScheduleOffset
nested_params.description: Specifies the optional offset that is added to the time interval for a schedule-triggered flow.

nested_params.name: FirstExecutionFrom
nested_params.description: Specifies the date range for the records to import from the connector in the first flow run.

parameters.name: ObjectTypeNames
parameters.description: A map in which each key is an event type from an external application such as Segment or Shopify, and each value is an ObjectTypeName (template) used to ingest the event. It supports the following event types: SegmentIdentify, ShopifyCreateCustomers, ShopifyUpdateCustomers, ShopifyCreateDraftOrders, ShopifyUpdateDraftOrders, ShopifyCreateOrders, and ShopifyUpdatedOrders. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: EventTriggerNames
parameters.description: A list of unique names for active event triggers associated with the integration. (string) ---

nested_items.name: DomainName
nested_items.description: The unique name of the domain.

nested_items.name: Uri
nested_items.description: The URI of the S3 bucket or any other type of data source.

nested_items.name: ObjectTypeName
nested_items.description: The name of the profile object type.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp of when the domain was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp of when the domain was most recently edited.

nested_items.name: ObjectTypeNames
nested_items.description: A map in which each key is an event type from an external application such as Segment or Shopify, and each value is an ObjectTypeName (template) used to ingest the event. It supports the following event types: SegmentIdentify, ShopifyCreateCustomers, ShopifyUpdateCustomers, ShopifyCreateDraftOrders, ShopifyUpdateDraftOrders, ShopifyCreateOrders, and ShopifyUpdatedOrders.

nested_items.name: IsUnstructured
nested_items.description: Boolean that shows if the Flow that's associated with the Integration is created in Amazon Appflow, or with ObjectTypeName equals _unstructured via API/CLI in flowDefinition.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role. The Integration uses this role to make Customer Profiles requests on your behalf.

nested_items.name: EventTriggerNames
nested_items.description: A list of unique names for active event triggers associated with the integration. This list would be empty if no Event Trigger is associated with the integration.
